meanings.definition: Relating to or using radiation, especially X-rays.
meanings.sent1: The radiological report showed a clear image of the broken bone.
meanings.sent2: The hospital has advanced radiological equipment for diagnosing illnesses.
meanings.sent3: The radiological technician accidentally turned into a glowing superhero after exposure to X-rays.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright as a radiological scan, lighting up the room.
meanings.sent5: The radiological glow of the sunset painted the sky in vibrant colors.

meanings.definition: Involving the use of radiology for medical imaging.
meanings.sent1: The radiological department at the hospital is always busy with patients.
meanings.sent2: Doctors rely on radiological tests to accurately diagnose various conditions.
meanings.sent3: The radiological team had a contest to see who could take the most creative X-ray.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a radiological machine, processing images with precision.
meanings.sent5: The radiological images revealed the hidden secrets of the body's inner workings.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the study or treatment of diseases using radiation.
meanings.sent1: The radiological oncologist specializes in treating cancer with radiation therapy.
meanings.sent2: Researchers are constantly improving radiological techniques to combat diseases.
meanings.sent3: The radiological lab mice glowed in the dark after the experiment.
meanings.sent4: His words were like radiological beams, targeting the heart of the issue.
meanings.sent5: The radiological treatment successfully shrunk the tumor without surgery.
